title: Ticket #208: Dagman.out files broken for external subdags
description:
On at least some platforms, the _CONDOR_DAGMAN_LOG environment variable gets goofed up for external subdags. (Instead of getting its own value of _CONDOR_DAGMAN_LOG, the lower-level DAGMan gets the parent DAGMan's value. This causes the lower-level DAGMan to write to the parent DAGMan's .dagman.out file.) (Pete and I verified that the environment variable is getting goofed up by looking at the classad for the child DAGMan saved in the nightly tests.)

Strangely enough, I can't duplicate this right now with some stand-alone test DAGs that I have. I'm working on changing my subdag test that's part of the test suite to detect the problem, though.

Pete and I (Kent) are suspicious of the recent daemoncore changes relating to how DAGMan deals with X509_CERT_DIR -- that's why I'm assigning this ticket to Nick.
remarks:
2009-02-10: The job_dagman_subdag-A test now checks for this problem.

2009-02-12: Okay, condor_submit environment fix from yesterday fixed this. The problem was that the "don't overwrite stuff from the environment line" check got accidentally left out when the condor_submit environment handling code got refactored. The change to condor_submit_dag didn't actually affect the problem.
